pros: Very sharp from edge to edge
Available for Micro Four Thirds and NEX cameras

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Prime Lens
customer_reviews.text: I took a vacation and used this lens almost exclusively while I was there, it took amazing photos and I was amazed, as was everyone else who saw the pictures, at how they turned out.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great budget lens and sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Great on Sony a6000 when setting at APC-S (autofocus at the center only). The autofocus works well at the center. Even though the lens does not focus as the native lens when you set the camera at continuous autofocus, I still think this is a great lens. The photos I've taken with it on a6000 are really sharp. It doesn't have OSS like the native lens so I do use a tripod in windy conditions. The beach photo taken below is with a tripod and I'm pleased with the image quality for a lens at this price. The second photo shows how the lens performs in low light/handheld condition and it wasn't that great but this is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased the Sony SEL50F18/B 50mm f/1.8 which is $100+ more than this lens, will probably return that in favor of this lens. It's small and compact, and the photos are sharp and have beautiful color. One thing I did notice (and consist with some of the other reviews) is the feeling of moving parts inside the lens when it is off. Nevertheless, the lens works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: shopaHolic

customer_reviews.title: Great walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great lens for its price. Sharp, expected of prime lens. Lightweight and compact Comes with lens case, cap and hood Cons: No image stabilization. Video struggles to focus. The shiny metallic finish leaves a lot of fingerprints. The lens make a clunky noise when focusing - this is a common complaint with the Sigma series. Slightly longer start up time with this lens on a Nex-7 but that's a software issue. Overall, a good walk around lens if f/2.8 is fast enough for your purposes.
customer_reviews.author: L & L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens for the price, I don't think you can find much better.
customer_reviews.text: It is obviously not as good as the 32mm Zeiss or other higher end lenses, but for this price range, at 30mm it vastly outperforms the kit 16-50mm lens and is a very good quality lens for the price. That said, I can only give it 4 stars because of how it's built. When the camera is powered off, the internals slide around inside the barrel and rattle a LOT and sound like the're broken. I fear that too much movement over time would damage the internals from all that banging around against the barrel ends.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Fast accurate focus
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a great addition to my primes. And for the price it performs very well. I am using this on a6000 Sony, which is an APS-C sensor camera. Thus this is at 45mm with crop factor which makes it slightly wide-angle. The lens performs very well and is very sharp, being the sharpest at about f4 to f8. The f2.8 is still very good but at this focal length it is harder to achieve a real shallow depth of field. The better lens would be a 32mm f/1.4 or f/1.8 lens, but the money spent is somewhat more. For the "normal" prime I would recommend this lens highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont be fooled by the price.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the price. Although it is generally true that you get what you pay for, sometimes you get more than you bargained for.This is an awesome lens ....... Very sharp ..... Superb IQ. It is on of my favorite lenses to use on my a6000. It has the perfect FOV for a walk around lens. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: EVFTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My favorite.  Great lens.  Great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens. It is exceptionally sharp. Pretty fast. The linear motor focusing mechanism does have one position where it won't start up properly without a bit of a rotation, but you'll be hard-pressed to find this position very easily. And shooting raw does leave you with a bit of barrel distortion on the edges of the image... but I shoot JPEG. For a great lens at this price point, there has to be some drawback. I guess the slight barrel distortion (corrected in software for JPEG only) is its only drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kirisaki

customer_reviews.title: at more than half the price of the Sony lens this was great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens for my A6000, the 35mm F1.8 lens from Sony was $450, since i'm not a professional photographer i was not looking to spend so much, at more than half the price of the Sony lens this was great value for money. It came highly recommended by other friends who are professional photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sigma F1.4 is better choice
customer_reviews.text: I compared F2.8 vith the new F1.4 lens. I feel F1.4 lens is better than the old F2.8. The negative side of F1.4 is 2 times longer and heavier.
customer_reviews.author: chris w.

customer_reviews.title: Great sharp focus and good bokeh.
customer_reviews.text: Great lens! I did a lot of research on a good prime lens for my a6000 before choosing this one based on price and quality. I was torn between this and the 60mm. This is definitely a great lens for portraits. Good bokeh and sharp focus. The auto focus is a little slow, but not really that noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Pem

customer_reviews.title: Much sharper than kit lens while sacrificing convenience in a zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: So I've had this for almost a year and ill say its sharp for its price. Best for street photography and somewhat portraits. I stopped using this lens because I want/need a sharp wide zoom which is almost impossible to get so if you dont mind constantly switching lenses, then get this for a cheap prime. Other wise just suck it up and save up for an expensive wide zoom.
customer_reviews.author: A. sh

customer_reviews.title: a very nice prime for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sigma 30mm f2.8 DN Lens (Sony E), $199. This is my fist lens for the Sony a6000, which I got body-only. The lens is light yet well made. The reviews show this to be a sharp lens, and the few pictures I've taken confirm that. If you shake the lens, you will hear something moving inside, but that is normal for this design. I like Lavikka's Photography's YouTube reviews.
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: We use it in the studio for a dedicated product shot lens at f11. Nice and sharp for the images on our websites. Fast lens not really required at this aperture, so its perfect for us. Focus is fast and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Rawls Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and results in a small, lightweight prime lens
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this lens. It's small, light weight, but produces excellent results. No, it's not a Zeiss lens -- but for ~~~~10% of the cost, I'm getting ~~~~97% of the results. That's a trade-off I'll make all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative for Sony 35mm
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to lens for my sony a6000. Amazing sharpness and a lot better foliage shots than sony lens. Really impressed by the performance and size. Encouraged me to try Sigma's 19mm and 60mm lenses
customer_reviews.author: UtmostCoin

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on my Sony a6300 and works just as expected
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this was well worth it. It's not the nicest lens by any means, but it certainly does the job and does it well. I haven't had any problems with it. The materials aren't top notch, but worth the cost. Fits great on my Sony a6300 and works just as expected.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the stock Lens.

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't decide if I should give this 3 or 4 stars. The lens is decent, but if you've used a higher priced lens before then you'll see the difference in clarity. Overall it's a good lens for the price, but I'll be upgrading as soon as I can afford a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh B

customer_reviews.title: Great Performer
customer_reviews.text: As expected, this lens is a stellar performer just like it's predecessor. I sold the previous version after it started to struggle to focus in low light on my NEX 6. I wasn’t sure if it was the camera or the lens. Then I started missing the quality after upgrading to the A6000 with the kit lens. This new version has a better build and comes with a lens shade. The quality is just outstanding with fast autofocus.
customer_reviews.author: MrVag

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you -- this is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: A far better lens than the price would suggest. I've never been a Sigma fan, but this lens changed my mind (along with its 60mm sibling). When the camera is powered down, the slight rattle (caused, I believe by floating elements that are held in place by electromagnets) is a little disconcerting at first, but I got used to it. Small price to pay for the excellent images.
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great portrait lens for my Sony a5100!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for people looking for an alternative to the kit lens for taking portraits. I'm very happy with the image quality I've been able to squeeze out of this thing.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

Honestly, I see no point in passing this up for Sony's pricier 35mm lens. I realize that one has optical steady shot, but given the difference in price you could pick up a good tripod to help you capture those shots requiring the steadiest of hands.

customer_reviews.title: OK but few flaws

customer_reviews.title: Try it You'll like it!

Try one you won't be sorry.

customer_reviews.title: the photos come out sharp with a very nice bokeh. I would recommend this to someone who ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer, so my review will be vague. So far, this lens performs as expected. It auto-focuses very well, & it has an extremely smooth focusing ring. The rattling stops once I turn the camera on, which I believe is how it is supposed to work. I got the item from Amazon's Warehouse Deals, so the packaging was roughed up a bit, but nothing to complain about. Even with my camera's digital tele-converter on, the photos come out sharp with a very nice bokeh. I would recommend this to someone who likes to shoot landscape photos. Its small size makes it portable & fun to carry around. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sweet prime to replace the kit zoom
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sharp prime lens for my Sony A6000 and this one fits the bill. I just returned from a trip to a farmer's market today in sunny August and the color rendition was the best I've ever seen my A6000 do, beautiful flowers, nice rich vegetables, etc. I do think the kit lens focuses a bit faster, though not much, but if you want a prime lens then at this price, it's a no-brainer. This lens has replaced the kit lens for my A6000 which was a hard thing to do since the kit zoom is actually pretty good. See my farmer's market photos of flowers, vegetables and paintings for sale.

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Quite clear, little distortion but moderate vignetting in certain conditions. I shoot wide open most of the time, and I'm quite pleased. That being said, with the widest aperture being f/2.8 this lens isn't particularly fast. Don't expect to see in the dark or luscious bokeh. AF is quick, the build quality is nice and I like operating the focus ring. It's also extremely quiet. For the price, you really can't go wrong. At the time of writing, however, the Sony 50mm f1.8 is only $50 more and if you want a lens with more purpose I would go with that.

customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews here and elsewhere, I was hoping to like this lens a lot more than I do. It's OK. For the price, it's decent.
